summary: This is a court-authorized notice of a proposed $290 million class action settlement between victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking venture and JPMorgan Chase Bank. The notice informs potential class members of their rights to submit a claim, object, or opt-out, and outlines the settlement's terms, including the plan for allocating funds to eligible victims.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: The named plaintiff representing the class of victims in the lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase Bank.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure whose alleged sex trafficking venture is the basis for the class action. The lawsuit claims JPMorgan facilitated his activities.

persons.name: Jed S. Rakoff
persons.context: United States District Judge overseeing the class action lawsuit and the proposed settlement hearing.

persons.name: Simone K. Lelchuk
persons.context: Individual appointed to administer the settlement claims, review questionnaires, and determine allocated amounts for victims.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Henderson Lehrman representing the class of victims.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Henderson Lehrman representing the class of victims.

persons.name: Layn Phillips
persons.context: Experienced mediator from Phillips ADR who facilitated the confidential settlement negotiations between the parties.

persons.name: Andrew Villacastin
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing the class; listed as a contact for objections.

persons.name: John Butts
persons.context: Attorney from Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale and Dorr LLP representing JPMorgan Chase Bank; listed as a contact for objections.

connections.description: Jane Doe 1 is a class representative alleging harm from Epstein's sex trafficking venture.
Henderson, as Class Counsel, legally represents Jane Doe 1 and the class of victims.
Edwards, as Class Counsel, legally represents Jane Doe 1 and the class of victims.
Phillips mediated the settlement negotiations between the class (represented by Jane Doe 1) and JPMorgan Chase.
Lelchuk, as Claims Administrator, will review claims and determine allocations for class members like Jane Doe 1.

events.title: Initial Complaint Filed
events.description: The initial class action complaint was filed against JPMorgan Chase Bank.

events.title: Amended Complaint Filed
events.description: An amended complaint was filed in the class action lawsuit.

events.title: Court Rules on Motion to Dismiss
events.description: The Court granted in part and denied in part JPMorgan Chase's motion to dismiss the complaint.

events.title: Confidential Mediation
events.description: The settling parties participated in a confidential mediation with Layn Phillips, leading to a settlement agreement.

events.title: Term Sheet Executed
events.description: The parties executed a Confidential Term Sheet memorializing their agreement to settle for $290 million.

events.title: Stipulation of Settlement Dated
events.description: The formal Stipulation of Settlement detailing the terms of the $290 million agreement was dated.

events.title: Settlement Fairness Hearing
events.description: Court hearing scheduled for Judge Rakoff to consider final approval of the $290 million settlement.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: JPMorgan Chase Bank agreed to a $290 million settlement to resolve a class action lawsuit alleging it facilitated Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking venture.
The class includes individuals who were abused or trafficked by Epstein or his associates between January 1, 1998, and August 10, 2019.
The lawsuit alleged JPMorgan violated the Trafficking Victims Protection Act by providing Epstein with banking services that enabled his activities and failing to report suspicious conduct.
JPMorgan denies all allegations of liability, wrongdoing, and knowledge of Epstein's sex trafficking venture.
Class Counsel (Boies Schiller Flexner LLP and Edwards Henderson Lehrman) will apply for attorneys' fees not to exceed 30% of the settlement fund.
